Detailed Description

Creates a command line program, with very few defaults.

To use, create a new Program() instance with argc, argv, and a help description. The templated add_option methods make it easy to prepare options. Remember to call .start before starting your program, so that the options can be evaluated and the help option doesn't accidentally run your program.

8255  break;
8256  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND:
8257  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR:
8258  case detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK:
8259  case detail::Classifier::NONE:
8260  default:
8261  throw HorribleError("parsing got called with invalid option! You should not see this");

8265  if (current_type == detail::Classifier::LONG)
8266  return opt->check_lname(arg_name);
8267  if (current_type == detail::Classifier::SHORT)
8268  return opt->check_sname(arg_name);
8269  // this will only get called for detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE
8270  return opt->check_lname(arg_name) || opt->check_sname(arg_name);
8271  });
8272

8274  if (op_ptr == std::end(options_)) {

8277  if (subc->_parse_arg(args, current_type)) {
8278  if (!subc->pre_parse_called_) {
8279  subc->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8280  }
8281  return true;
8282  }
8283  }
8284  }
8285  // If a subcommand, try the main command
8286  if (parent_ != nullptr && fallthrough_)
8287  return _get_fallthrough_parent()->_parse_arg(args, current_type);
8288  // don't capture missing if this is a nameless subcommand
8289  if (parent_ != nullptr && name_.empty()) {
8290  return false;
8291  }
8292  // Otherwise, add to missing
8293  args.pop_back();
8294  _move_to_missing(current_type, current);
8295  return true;
8296  }
8297 
8298  args.pop_back();

8301  Option_p& op = *op_ptr;
8303  if (op->get_inject_separator()) {
8304  if (!op->results().empty() && !op->results().back().empty()) {
8305  op->add_result(std::string{});
8306  }
8307  }
8308  if (op->get_trigger_on_parse() && op->current_option_state_ == Option::option_state::callback_run) {
8309  op->clear();
8310  }
8311  int min_num = (std::min)(op->get_type_size_min(), op->get_items_expected_min());
8312  int max_num = op->get_items_expected_max();
8313  // check container like options to limit the argument size to a single type if the allow_extra_flags argument is
8314  // set. 16 is somewhat arbitrary (needs to be at least 4)
8315  if (max_num >= detail::expected_max_vector_size / 16 && !op->get_allow_extra_args()) {
8316  auto tmax = op->get_type_size_max();
8317  max_num = detail::checked_multiply(tmax, op->get_expected_min()) ? tmax : detail::expected_max_vector_size;
8318  }
8319  // Make sure we always eat the minimum for unlimited vectors
8320  int collected = 0; // total number of arguments collected
8321  int result_count = 0; // local variable for number of results in a single arg string
8322  // deal with purely flag like things
8323  if (max_num == 0) {
8324  auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, value);
8325  op->add_result(res);
8326  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8327  } else if (!value.empty()) { // --this=value
8328  op->add_result(value, result_count);
8329  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8330  collected += result_count;
8331  // -Trest
8332  } else if (!rest.empty()) {
8333  op->add_result(rest, result_count);
8334  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8335  rest = "";
8336  collected += result_count;
8337  }
8338 
8339  // gather the minimum number of arguments
8340  while (min_num > collected && !args.empty()) {
8341  std::string current_ = args.back();
8342  args.pop_back();
8343  op->add_result(current_, result_count);
8344  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8345  collected += result_count;
8346  }
8347 
8348  if (min_num > collected) { // if we have run out of arguments and the minimum was not met
8349  throw ArgumentMismatch::TypedAtLeast(op->get_name(), min_num, op->get_type_name());
8350  }
8351 
8352  if (max_num > collected || op->get_allow_extra_args()) { // we allow optional arguments
8353  auto remreqpos = _count_remaining_positionals(true);
8354  // we have met the minimum now optionally check up to the maximum
8355  while ((collected < max_num || op->get_allow_extra_args()) && !args.empty() &&
8356  _recognize(args.back(), false) == detail::Classifier::NONE) {
8357  // If any required positionals remain, don't keep eating
8358  if (remreqpos >= args.size()) {
8359  break;
8360  }
8361 
8362  op->add_result(args.back(), result_count);
8363  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8364  args.pop_back();
8365  collected += result_count;
8366  }
8367 
8368  // Allow -- to end an unlimited list and "eat" it
8369  if (!args.empty() && _recognize(args.back()) == detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK)
8370  args.pop_back();
8371  // optional flag that didn't receive anything now get the default value
8372  if (min_num == 0 && max_num > 0 && collected == 0) {
8373  auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, std::string{});
8374  op->add_result(res);
8375  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8376  }
8377  }
8378 
8379  // if we only partially completed a type then add an empty string for later processing
8380  if (min_num > 0 && op->get_type_size_max() != min_num && (collected % op->get_type_size_max()) != 0) {
8381  op->add_result(std::string{});
8382  }
8383  if (op->get_trigger_on_parse()) {
8384  op->run_callback();
8385  }
8386  if (!rest.empty()) {
8387  rest = "-" + rest;
8388  args.push_back(rest);
8389  }
8390  return true;
8391  }

◆ _parse_positional()

bool CLI::App::_parse_positional ( std::vector< std::string > &  args,
bool  haltOnSubcommand 
)
inlineprotected

Parse a positional, go up the tree to check

Parameters
haltOnSubcommandif set to true the operation will not process subcommands merely return false Return true if the positional was used false otherwise

Try to find a local subcommand that is repeated

now try one last gasp at subcommands that have been executed before, go to root app and try to find a subcommand in a broader way, if one exists let the parent deal with it

If this is an option group don't deal with it

We are out of other options this goes to missing

◆ add_option() [3/4]

Option* CLI::App::add_option ( std::string  option_name,
callback_t  option_callback,
std::string  option_description = "",
bool  defaulted = false,
std::function< std::string()>  func = {} 
)
inline

Add an option, will automatically understand the type for common types.

To use, create a variable with the expected type, and pass it in after the name. After start is called, you can use count to see if the value was passed, and the value will be initialized properly. Numbers, vectors, and strings are supported.

->required(), ->default, and the validators are options, The positional options take an optional number of arguments.

For example, 

std::string filename;
program.add_option("filename", filename, "description of filename");
